place.name: SALHOUSE
place.gazetteerText: SALHOUSE, or Sallowes, a parish, with a village, in St. Faith district, Norwich; on the North Walsam railway, 6 miles N E by E of Norwich. Post-town, Norwich. Acres, 2,060. Real property, £3, 325. Pop., 684. Houses, 143. The manor belongs to W. H. Trafford, Esq. S. Hall is the seat of Mrs. Ward. The living is a vicarage, annexed to Wroxham, in the diocese of Norwich. The church is a plain building, with a tower; and contains a Templar's coffin and several monuments. There are two Baptist chapels, a national school, a rural institute, and charities £24. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
